comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Almost certainly. This is probably at the annual garden party at Governor's Island on May 28, 1914. Described in NYT of May 29,1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B05E0D8173AE633A... She and her husband received the guests.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F20C11F8345D13738... indicates that in July 1914 Brig. Gen Robert K. Evans was being transferred from his post at Governors Island, which he had occupied since "last March as a stop-gap." So he would have been in position at Governors Island for the 1914 garden party.
